faqs.question: Is Costa Blanca a good place to buy property?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Costa Blanca offers consistent property appreciation of 8% year-on-year, excellent year-round climate with over 300 days of sunshine, and established infrastructure. Values remain significantly below Spanish islands while offering superior lifestyle and investment returns.

faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign nationals can purchase Spanish property without restrictions. We assist with legal documentation, NIE registration, and financing options. Most EU and international buyers complete purchases smoothly with proper guidance.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect approximately 10-12% in acquisition costs including: transfer tax (6-10%), notary fees (0.3-1%), registry fees (0.1%), and legal fees (1-2%). Our team provides detailed cost breakdowns before purchase.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa to buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Property purchase doesn't require a visa independently. However, residency visas are available through investment routes. UK, EU, and US citizens enjoy favorable residency programs. We can advise on visa options alongside your property purchase.

faqs.question: How much are property taxes in Spain?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (IBI) averages 0.4-1.1% of cadastral value. Capital gains tax applies if selling at profit (19-45% depending on ownership duration). We provide a complete tax breakdown for your specific property investment.
